New Records: Victor Wembanyama scored 29 points, Jeremy Sochan added 17 points and 12 rebounds, and the San Antonio Spurs held on to beat the Houston Rockets 109-106 on Saturday night in their home opener.
Key Match Events: The Rockets went on a 21-8 run in the opening six minutes of the final quarter, turning an 18-point deficit into a 95-90 lead for San Antonio.
After struggling mightily at times last season to get the ball into Wembanyamaâ€™s hands around the rim, a pair of passes from Paul yielded much promise and thunderous celebrations.
San Antonio coach Gregg Popovich has stressed the need for his team to be more physical and the Spurs responded, outrebounding Houston 57-46.
Pre-Game Insights: After trailing by 22 points in the first half, Houston was within one possession for much of the final minutes.
Post-Match Reflections: San Antonio went 2 for 13 on 3-pointers after opening the game 6 for 7.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Victor Wembanyama's efficient night leads the @spurs to the win in their home opener!
Rockets: Houston wasted a good finish with a poor start. After shooting 34% through three quarters, including 17% in the second period, the Rockets shot 60% in the final quarter.
Spurs: San Antonio went 2 for 13 on 3-pointers after opening the game 6 for 7.
The Rockets face the Spurs again on Monday to close out a two-game set in San Antonio.
Others: San Antonio coach Gregg Popovich has stressed the need for his team to be more physical.
Wembanyama added seven rebounds and three blocks while shooting 10 for 17 from the field.
Jalen Green had 27 points for Houston. Fred VanVleet added 18 and Dillon Brooks had 16.
